DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the default filter state when the page loads
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Observe filter dropdowns
EXPECTED RESULT: All four filters (TOC, Class, Depot, Unit) show "All" by default. All cases are displayed in the table.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can filter cases by TOC
TEST STEPS:
1. Click TOC dropdown
2. Select a specific TOC (e.g., "GWR")
3. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Only cases for selected TOC are displayed. Summary counters update to reflect filtered cases. Train diagram updates if applicable.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can filter cases by Class
TEST STEPS:
1. Click Class dropdown
2. Select a specific Class (e.g., "Class 165")
3. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Only cases for selected Class are displayed. Summary counters and train diagram update accordingly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can filter cases by Depot
TEST STEPS:
1. Click Depot dropdown
2. Select a specific Depot
3. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Only cases for selected Depot are displayed. Summary counters update.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can filter cases by Unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Click Unit dropdown
2. Select a specific Unit (e.g., "150208")
3. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Only cases for selected Unit are displayed. Summary counters update. Train diagram shows only the selected unit.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can filter cases using multiple criteria with cascading dropdowns
TEST STEPS:
1. Select TOC = "XCT"
2. Observe Class, Depot, and Unit dropdowns now show only options available for XCT
3. Select a Class from the filtered options
4. Select a Depot from the filtered options
5. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Only cases matching ALL selected criteria are displayed. Dropdowns cascade to show only relevant options based on previous selections. Counters update accordingly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can apply filters using the Apply button
TEST STEPS:
1. Select any filter value
2. DO NOT click Apply
3. Observe case list (should not change)
4. Click Apply
5. Observe case list updates
EXPECTED RESULT: Filter is not applied until Apply button is clicked. Cases update only after Apply is clicked.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can clear all filters using the Clear button
TEST STEPS:
1. Select values in multiple filters
2. Click Apply
3. Click Clear button
EXPECTED RESULT: All filters reset to "All". All cases are displayed again. Summary counters show totals for all cases.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see appropriate messaging when filters return no results
TEST STEPS:
1. Select filter combination that has no matching cases
2. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Case table shows "No cases found" or empty state. Summary counters show 0 for all categories. Train diagram shows no units or appropriate empty state.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see summary counters update when filters are applied
TEST STEPS:
1. Note initial counter values (Total, New, Completed, Monitor, Rejected)
2. Apply any filter
3. Compare counter values
EXPECTED RESULT: Counters show counts only for filtered cases (e.g., if 2 rejected cases are visible after filter, Rejected counter shows 2).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the train diagram update when filtering by Unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Select specific Unit from Unit filter
2. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Counters show counts only for the selected Unit. The train diagram is also updated to the respective image. The cases shown are specfic to the selected Unit.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see filters cascade based on my selections
TEST STEPS:
1. Select TOC
2. Open Class dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: Class dropdown shows only classes relevant to selected TOC.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see my filter selections persist during my session
TEST STEPS:
1. Apply specific filters
2. Click on a case to view details
3. Return to case list page
EXPECTED RESULT: Previously applied filters remain selected. Case list shows filtered results.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can change individual filters back to All while keeping other filters active
TEST STEPS:
1. Select TOC, Class, and Depot filters
2. Click Apply
3. Change TOC back to "All"
4. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Cases now filtered only by Class and Depot. TOC filter is effectively removed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all required columns in filtered case results
TEST STEPS:
1. Apply any filter
2. Review case table
EXPECTED RESULT: Filtered cases display all columns: ID, Unit, Vehicle, System, Status, Priority, Title, Date.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can navigate through paginated filtered results
TEST STEPS:
1. Apply filter that returns more than 100 cases
2. Check pagination at bottom of table
EXPECTED RESULT: Pagination shows correct page count for filtered results (e.g., "1-4 of 150"). Navigation works correctly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all available filter options in the dropdowns
TEST STEPS:
1. Click TOC dropdown
2. Click Class dropdown
3. Click Depot dropdown
4. Click Unit dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: All dropdowns show "All" option plus all available values from database (TOCs, Classes, Depots, Units).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all summary counters displayed on page load
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Observe summary counter section
EXPECTED RESULT: Four summary counters are displayed: Total, Open, Completed, and Rejected. Each shows a numerical value.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all counters accurately reflect the number of cases for each status
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Apply a filter
3. Note all counter values (Total, Open, Completed, Rejected)
4. Count cases in the case table for each status
5. Compare counter values with actual counts
EXPECTED RESULT: Each counter accurately matches the number of cases in the filtered results: Total reflects all filtered cases, Open reflects filtered cases with Open status, Completed reflects filtered cases with Completed status, and Rejected reflects filtered cases with Rejected status.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can verify that status counters sum equals the Total counter
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Note all counter values
3. Add Open + Completed + Rejected
EXPECTED RESULT: The sum of Open, Completed, and Rejected counters equals the Total counter (accounting for any other statuses if applicable).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters display zero when no cases exist for a status
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Identify any counter showing 0
3. Verify no cases in the table have that status
EXPECTED RESULT: Counter displays 0 when no cases have that status. Display is clear and readable.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters are clearly formatted and readable
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Review counter display formatting
EXPECTED RESULT: Each counter displays a large number above a status label. Spacing and typography are consistent. Counters are visually distinct from each other.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters update when a new case is created
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Click "Create New Case" button
3. Complete case creation with a specific status
4. Return to case list
5. Observe counter values
EXPECTED RESULT: Total counter increases by 1. The relevant status counter (e.g., Open) also increases by 1. Other counters remain unchanged.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters update when a case status changes
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Open a case with Status = "Open"
3. Change status to "Completed"
4. Save and return to case list
EXPECTED RESULT: Open counter decreases by 1. Completed counter increases by 1. Total counter remains unchanged.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see accurate counter values after refreshing the page
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Refresh the page (F5 or browser refresh)
3. Observe counter values after page reload
EXPECTED RESULT: Counter values remain accurate and consistent with the cases in the database.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I cannot see the unit visualisation when no unit is selected
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Ensure Unit filter is set to "All"
3. Observe the area between summary counters and case table
EXPECTED RESULT: No train diagram is displayed. The area between summary counters and case table is empty or shows placeholder content.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the unit visualisation when I select a specific unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Select a specific unit from the Unit dropdown (e.g., "150208")
3. Click Apply
4. Observe the area between summary counters and case table
EXPECTED RESULT: Train diagram is displayed showing visual representation of the selected unit. The unit shows carriages with appropriate styling.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see accurate carriage representation for the selected unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a 2-car unit from the Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Observe carriage configuration
4. Select a 3-car unit from the Unit dropdown
5. Click Apply
6. Observe carriage configuration
EXPECTED RESULT: Train diagram displays the correct number and configuration of carriages for the selected unit (e.g., 2-car units show 2 carriages, 3-car units show 3 carriages).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see subsystem highlighting on the train diagram
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from the Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Observe the train diagram
EXPECTED RESULT: Highlighted sections are displayed on the train diagram showing different subsystems (e.g., pink/red areas on carriages). The highlighting is always present regardless of alert status.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the visualisation disappear when I clear the unit filter
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a specific unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Verify train diagram is displayed
4. Click Clear button
5. Observe the train diagram area
EXPECTED RESULT: Unit filter is reset to "All". Train diagram disappears and is no longer visible.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the visualisation update when I select a different unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a specific unit (e.g., "150208") from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Note the train diagram displayed
4. Select a different unit (e.g., "150213") from Unit dropdown
5. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Train diagram updates to show the newly selected unit. Carriage configuration updates to reflect the new unit.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the visualisation persist when applying other filters
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Verify train diagram is displayed
4. Select a TOC or Class filter
5. Click Apply
EXPECTED RESULT: Train diagram remains visible as long as the unit filter is still set to a specific unit. The diagram continues to show the selected unit even when other filters are applied.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can click on subsystem blocks to select them
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Observe the subsystem blocks on the train diagram
4. Click on a subsystem block
EXPECTED RESULT: The clicked subsystem block is visually selected (e.g.  highlighted border or visual change). The subsystem is added to the filter criteria.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see cases filtered when I select subsystems
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Note the current case count in the case table
4. Click on one or more subsystem blocks on the train diagram
5. Observe the case table
EXPECTED RESULT: Case table updates to show only cases related to the selected subsystem(s). Cases unrelated to the selected subsystems are hidden.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see summary counters update when I select subsystems
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Note the current summary counter values
4. Click on one or more subsystem blocks on the train diagram
5. Observe the summary counters
EXPECTED RESULT: Summary counters (Total, Open, Completed, Rejected) update to reflect only cases related to the selected subsystem(s).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can select multiple subsystems simultaneously
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Click on a subsystem block (e.g., green block)
4. Click on another subsystem block (e.g., red block)
5. Observe the train diagram and case table
EXPECTED RESULT: Both subsystem blocks are visually selected. Case table shows cases related to either of the selected subsystems. Summary counters update accordingly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can deselect a subsystem by clicking it again
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Click on a subsystem block to select it
4. Verify cases are filtered
5. Click the same subsystem block again
EXPECTED RESULT: The subsystem block is deselected (visual selection removed). Case table and summary counters update to remove the subsystem filter. If no subsystems remain selected, all cases for the unit are displayed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can clear all subsystem selections using the Clear button
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Click on one or more subsystem blocks
4. Verify cases are filtered
5. Click the Clear button
EXPECTED RESULT: All subsystem selections are cleared. Unit filter is reset to "All". Train diagram disappears. Case table shows all cases. Summary counters show totals for all cases.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can visually distinguish between selected and unselected subsystems
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Observe all subsystem blocks in their default state
4. Click on one subsystem block
5. Compare selected vs unselected subsystem blocks
EXPECTED RESULT: Selected subsystem blocks are coloured in. Unselected subsystem blocks maintain their default appearance. The difference is easily distinguishable.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see subsystem selections persist when switching views
TEST STEPS:
1. Select a unit from Unit dropdown
2. Click Apply
3. Click on one or more subsystem blocks
4. Click on a case to view details
5. Return to case list page
EXPECTED RESULT: Previously selected subsystems remain selected. Train diagram shows the same subsystem selections. Case table shows the filtered results.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can open the Create Case dialog
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Click the "Create New Case" button
3. Observe the dialog
EXPECTED RESULT: Create Case dialog opens as a modal overlay. Dialog displays all form fields: Title, Unit, Vehicle, System, Status, Priority, Description, Initial Meeting Minute, and Initial Record.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can close the Create Case dialog using the X button
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Observe the dialog is open
3. Click the X button in the top right corner of the dialog
EXPECTED RESULT: Dialog closes without creating a case. User returns to the Case Management page. No new case is created.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can cancel case creation using the Cancel button
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Fill in some fields
3. Click the "Cancel" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Dialog closes without creating a case. User returns to the Case Management page. No new case is created. Any entered data is discarded.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see validation when required fields are missing or invalid
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Leave required fields empty
3. Click "Create Case" button
4. Observe validation messages
EXPECTED RESULT: Validation prevents case creation. Clear error messages or visual indicators show which fields are required or invalid. Case is not created until required fields are completed correctly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all dropdown fields populated with valid options
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Click on Unit dropdown
3. Click on Vehicle dropdown
4. Click on System dropdown
5. Click on Status dropdown
6. Click on Priority dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: All dropdown fields display appropriate options from the database. Unit shows available units, Vehicle shows available vehicles, System shows subsystems, Status shows available statuses (Open, Completed, Rejected), Priority shows priority levels.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can successfully create a new case with all fields completed
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Enter Title
3. Select Unit
4. Select Vehicle
5. Select System
6. Select Status
7. Select Priority
8. Enter Description
9. Enter Initial Meeting Minute
10. Enter Initial Record
11. Click "Create Case" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Case is created successfully. Dialog closes. User returns to Case Management page. New case appears in the case table. Summary counters update to include the new case. Success message may be displayed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can create a case with only required fields
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Complete only required fields
3. Leave optional fields empty
4. Click "Create Case" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Case is created successfully with required fields populated. Optional fields are saved as empty/null. New case appears in the case table.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can enter text in all free text fields
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Click in the Title field and type text
3. Click in the Description field and type multi-line text
4. Click in the Initial Meeting Minute field and type multi-line text
5. Click in the Initial Record field and type multi-line text
EXPECTED RESULT: All text fields accept input. Title field accepts single-line text. Description, Initial Meeting Minute, and Initial Record fields accept multi-line text with line breaks preserved. Text is visible as typed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see default values pre-populated in the form
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Observe the Status and Priority fields
EXPECTED RESULT: Status field defaults to a sensible value (e.g., "New" or "Open"). Priority field defaults to a sensible value (e.g., "Medium"). Other fields may have defaults based on current filter selections.

FEATURE: Create Case - Vehicle Depends on Unit
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the Vehicle dropdown update based on selected Unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Select a specific Unit
3. Open the Vehicle dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: Vehicle dropdown shows only vehicles associated with the selected Unit. Vehicles are filtered appropriately.

FEATURE: Create Case - Case Appears in Table
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see my newly created case appear in the case table
TEST STEPS:
1. Create a new case successfully
2. Observe the case table
EXPECTED RESULT: New case appears in the case table with all entered information displayed correctly (Title, Unit, Vehicle, System, Status, Priority, Date). Case is positioned appropriately in the table (e.g., at the top or sorted by date).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see summary counters update after creating a case
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current summary counter values
2. Create a new case with Status = "Open"
3. Observe summary counters
EXPECTED RESULT: Total counter increases by 1. Open counter increases by 1. Other status counters remain unchanged.

FEATURE: Case Detail View - Open and Close
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can open and close the case detailed view modal
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Locate a case in the case table
3. Click on the case row
4. Review the header section (case ID, title, status, priority, unit, vehicle)
5. Review the Description section
6. Click on the area outside of the modal
EXPECTED RESULT: Detailed view modal opens as an overlay. Modal displays case header with all information correct and matching the selected case. Description is displayed below the header with readable formatting. Tabs are displayed (Records, Work Orders, Alerts). Edit Case and Reject Case buttons are visible. Clicking outside the modal closes it and returns to the Case Management page with previously applied filters intact.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can navigate between tabs in the detailed view
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Observe which tab is active by default
3. Click on the Work Orders tab
4. Click on the Alerts tab
5. Return to the Records tab
EXPECTED RESULT: Records tab is active by default when opening the modal. Records content is displayed immediately. Each tab becomes active when clicked (highlighted/underlined). Tab content updates to show the relevant information. Navigation between tabs is smooth and content loads correctly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all records associated with a case
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Ensure Records tab is active
3. Review the records table
EXPECTED RESULT: Records table displays two columns: DATE and RECORD. All records associated with the case are displayed in chronological order. Dates and record text are clearly visible.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can add , edit and delete records
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Click Records tab
3. Click "Add New Record" button
4. Select a date and enter text in the Update field
5. Click Save to create the record
6. Click Cancel on another new record to verify cancellation
7. Click Edit button on an existing record
8. Modify the record text and save changes
9. Click Delete button on a record
10. Confirm deletion
EXPECTED RESULT: Add New Record dialog opens with Date and Update fields. New records are created and saved successfully, appearing in chronological order. Cancel discards entered data without creating a record. Existing records can be edited and changes are saved. Records can be deleted and are permanently removed from the records table. Edit and Delete buttons are available on each record row.

FEATURE: Work Orders Tab - View Work Orders
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all work orders linked to a case
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Click Work Orders tab
3. Review the work orders table
EXPECTED RESULT: Work orders table displays all linked work orders with columns: ID, REPORT, ACTION, DATE, ROOT CODE, SYMPTOM, STATUS. All work order information is clearly visible and accurate.

FEATURE: Work Orders Tab - Link and Unlink Work Orders
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can link and unlink work orders to a case
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Click Work Orders tab
3. Click on the "Select a work order" dropdown
4. Select a work order from the dropdown list
5. Click Add button
6. Verify work order appears in the table
7. Click unlink/remove option on a linked work order
8. Confirm removal if prompted
9. Open a case with no linked work orders and verify empty state
EXPECTED RESULT: Dropdown opens and displays available work orders with scrollbar if needed. Selected work order is linked and appears in the table with all details (ID, REPORT, ACTION, DATE, ROOT CODE, SYMPTOM, STATUS). Dropdown resets after adding. Work orders can be unlinked and are removed from the table for this case. Empty state shows appropriate message when no work orders are linked.

FEATURE: Alerts Tab - View Alerts with Priority
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all alerts associated with a case with priority indicators
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Click Alerts tab
3. Review the alerts displayed
4. Review alert priority badges
EXPECTED RESULT: All alerts linked to the case are displayed as individual cards. Each alert card shows priority badge (HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW), timestamp, alert title, and alert description. Priority badges are visually distinct with different colours or styling. Priority is easily identifiable at a glance.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can view the signal trace visualization for an alert
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view
2. Click Alerts tab
3. Locate alerts with View Trace buttons
4. Click "View trace" button on an alert
5. Review the signal trace visualization
EXPECTED RESULT: Each alert card displays a "View trace" button. Button is clearly visible and clickable. Signal trace visualization is displayed showing a time-series graph. Graph displays signal values over time with time offset labels (e.g., -2m to +2m). Data points and trend line are clearly visible. Graph title shows the signal name and time window.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see appropriate messaging when no alerts are linked
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case with no linked alerts
2. Click Alerts tab
EXPECTED RESULT: Alerts section is empty or shows "No alerts linked" message. No alert cards are displayed.

FEATURE: Case Detail View - Edit and Reject Case
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can edit a case or reject a case using the action buttons
TEST STEPS:
1. Open a case detailed view with Status other than Rejected
2. Click the "Edit Case" button
3. Verify edit functionality
4. Return to case detail view
5. Click the "Reject Case" button
6. Provide rejection reason if prompted
7. Confirm rejection
8. Open a case with Status = Rejected
9. Observe the Reject Case button state
EXPECTED RESULT: Edit Case dialog opens allowing modification of case details (title, unit, vehicle, system, status, priority, description) with current information pre-populated. Reject Case button successfully updates case status to Rejected and saves rejection reason if provided. Modal may close or update to reflect new status. Case appears as Rejected in the case table. For already rejected cases, Reject Case button is disabled, greyed out, or not displayed.
